page.title: 15CASTLEFORD'S TRANSPORT
page.content: Castleford provides a local bus service. Most buses go westwards into urban areas of West Yorkshire. Castleford provides a small local rail service to Leeds and Goole.These Metro trains look and sound like buses.You pay the conductor during a trip. A major freight distribution centre near-by results in about 50-55 freight trains per day passing through Castleford on the main line between Teesside and the Midlands. Canal push tugs carry coal from local collieries to Ferrybridge Power station.Barges bring oil upstream from Immingham. A few pleasure boats use the river, particularly on Sundays. A family survey of private transport showed that 66% have cars,61% have pedal cycles,3% have motorcycles and 12% rely on public transport.
